p:
Coronaviruses are members of the family Coronaviridae that present crown-like spikes on their surface visualised by electron microscopy. The subfamily Coronavirinae contains the four genera Alpha, Beta, Gamma, and Deltacoronavirus. Coronaviruses infect birds (gamma and deltacoronaviruses) and several mammalian species (mainly alpha and betacoronaviruses), including humans.
